subject: AI
title: Showing AI Limitations
description: Be upfront about what the AI can't do.

hook.text: 'AI-powered financial advisor' sounds impressive until a user asks about tax law in Brazil and gets US tax advice applied to their situation. The AI didn't know its own boundaries.

buildup.text: Every AI feature has a scope: what it's trained on, what data it has access to, what it can and can't do. Communicate this clearly in the UI.

discovery.text: Simple patterns: a disclaimer bar ('This AI assistant knows about our product catalog. For medical questions, consult a doctor.'), or a capabilities page users can reference.

twist.text: Users skip disclaimers. Put limitations where they're relevant: if the user asks about something out of scope, respond with the limitation in context, not in a help page they'll never read.

climax.text: Contextual limitations > blanket disclaimers. Tell users what the AI can't do right when they try to do it.

punchline.text: An AI that knows what it doesn't know is more useful than one that pretends to know everything.

quiz.question: What's more effective than a blanket AI disclaimer?
options: Contextual limitations shown when the user asks something out of scope
